channel.title: Ugly, Bright-Green Trees [PI]
channel.description: I need some assistance removing the ugly bright green trees found on a lot of PI clients. Unfortunately, my cache is corrupted, or atleast i believe it is, because i cannot use toms cache editor with it. Therefore, I do not know an alternate way to remove this tree model. Any help? I really do not want to do every tree one by one..

item.title: Ugly, Bright-Green Trees [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Welliton_inc, post:9, topic:552054”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670971.msg4487327#msg4487327 date=1434996756]
2) Place the 1570.dat into a “Raw” or “Models” folder, and preload the model.
[/quote]

This method wont work if you’re trying to fix an object. Pretty sure you have to repack the model if it is an object that is overwritten. Even if you do compress your models which are in .dat format.[/quote]
Yes it will as long as you load the preloaded models after the models from the cache.

It’s just like custom items…
You can put the model in the cache (The right way)
or you can preload it.

It really just depends when/where the model is loaded.
If you load the new tree model first, it won’t work because the cache will load the old ugly broken model after.
If you load the old ugly model from the cache first, it will work because the new tree model overwrites the old.

Read full topic

item.title: Ugly, Bright-Green Trees [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

sk8rdude461:

2) Place the 1570.dat into a “Raw” or “Models” folder, and preload the model.

This method wont work if you’re trying to fix an object. Pretty sure you have to repack the model if it is an object that is overwritten. Even if you do compress your models which are in .dat format.

Read full topic

item.title: Ugly, Bright-Green Trees [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

As far as I know, my cache is corrupt as well.
Here are some possible solutions:

  1. gzip the 1570.dat, edit the name to be “1570.gz” and then use galkons index repacking method to pack the model (I did this, and my trees are find and dandy now)
  2. Place the 1570.dat into a “Raw” or “Models” folder, and preload the model.
  3. Use ModelCompression to load the model from a model.dat/idx file, instead of the raw folder (Faster than using the folders).

Links:

  1. Index Repacking
  2. Preloading models
  3. Model Compressor
    [URL=http://upx.nz/UfPgXe]Model Compressor Download (Couldn’t find it, had a copy myself, reuploaded)[/URL]

Read full topic

item.title: Ugly, Bright-Green Trees [PI]
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

[quote=“Welliton_inc, post:6, topic:552054”][quote author=beale link=topic=670971.msg4487220#msg4487220 date=1434915674]

cum all over them properly and they might tend to go away over time. give it a try.

-Kind Reguards from Paul, Owner/Dev of PkLegacy

What?

Anyway, what you will need to do is just get the old tree model (1570) and repack that.

I tried that but i believe my cache is corrupted. I’m not positive about that, but whenever i load it in a cache editor, it wont let me do anything with it
[/quote]

In which case, you’re going to need to fix the cache. I’ve seen many tutorials on how to fix a corrupt cache. Rune Server is filled with these tutorials I’m sure. Just google it and see what pops up.[/quote]

EDIT: Everything I have seen says that there is no fix for the corrupted cache.

Read full topic
